data.title: Black-tailed Prairie Dog
data.text:
Scientific Name: Cynomys ludovicianus

The largest prairie dog town ever recorded stretched for 25,096 square miles under the Texas prairie. Nearly 400 million prairie dogs lived in this town.

Size: Weight: Average 3 pounds; Height: Average 16.5 inches

Diet: Leaves, stems, the occasional insect and the roots of grasses and weeds

Habitat: Dry, flat or gently sloping, open grasslands with low, relatively sparse vegetation

Range in the Wild: Extreme South Central Canada, through the United States and into Northeastern Mexico

Conservation Status

Listed as Least Concern. They are widespread with an estimated population to be in the millions.
